events.message: The policyholder filed a claim reporting a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 30, 2024, involving another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of a vehicle collision provided in the initial report.
An experienced claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the investigation and processing of the motor vehicle accident claim.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgement letter to the claimant confirming reception of the claim and outlining the next steps.
The claimant was requested to submit photos of vehicle damage, the police accident report, and repair estimates to proceed with claim evaluation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including detailed photographs of the damaged car, the official police report, and mechanic assessments.
The assigned agent began investigating the claim by reviewing submitted evidence and contacting involved parties for further clarification.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of liability and verification of the damage extent consistent with the collision described.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount to the claimant covering all repair costs and applicable deductibles after investigation.
The claimant responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the offer and clarity of communication.
After receiving positive customer feedback, the claim was formally approved to proceed with payment issuance for the vehicle repairs.
The insurance company issued payment to the policyholder to cover the full approved amount of the auto repair costs.
The claim was officially closed after payment was successfully processed and the policyholder confirmed resolution satisfaction.
All documents and records related to the auto accident claim were archived according to company policy for future reference and audit.
